channel.title: Transformation Models
channel.description: Research and Software for Transformation Models

item.title: useR! 2019 Tutorial Material Available
item.description:
Slides and R code for the pre-conference tutorial on transformation models (afternoon session on Tuesday, 2019-07-09) at useR! 2019 in Toulouse, France, is now available.

The zip archive useR2019_transformation_models.zip contains a PDF file with slides (4up in case you want to bring a hard copy) as well as an R transcript file for reproducing all results. Some models take a little longer to fit (roughly 10mins on my computer). You donâ€™t need to run the code, but please make sure to install the current CRAN versions of the necessary packages (listed at the beginning of this file).

item.title: PostDoc in Zurich Available
item.description: A PostDoc position is available at the Department of Biostatistics in the Epidemiology, Biostatistics and Prevention Institute (University of Zurich, Switzerland). If you are interested in pushing the boundaries of transformation models, apply!

item.title: Zurich Tutorial
item.description: Sit back, relax, and enjoy two days of fun with transformation models in Zurich, Switzerland. The course Transformation Analysis in R takes place 2019-09-26/27.

item.title: useR! 2019 Tutorial
item.description: Sit back, relax, and enjoy three hours of fun with transformation models in the pre-conference tutorial on 2019-07-09 (afternoon) at useR! 2019 in Toulouse, France.

item.title: New Website Online!
item.description: The new webpage features information on fully parametric conditional transformation models. Links to methodological papers, software packages, novel developments, and recent events will be presented here.
